channel.title: Some useful MSN Scripts
channel.description:
[size=20pt]JUST UPLOADED! [/size]
[b][size=10pt]MSN auto-reply.[/size][/b] It will detect any open chats, then reply to them and close the window. Basically its abit tougher to use. Drag the crosshair onto your taskbar. Then adjust the number of seconds under the constants, and also adjust the text you want written. The DTM might NOT work because I'm using a fake vista skin, so for those using XP it might be abit buggy, but it SHOULD work. Hope you guys enjoy this one. BTW, please close all existing windows, or it will detect and close them.
[b] Spamfest[/b] types in words very fast. Edit the const 'waittime' to show how long you want the script to run. It is now currently set to 60 seconds. [b] Nudge[/b] is a script that nudges your contacts , but you must have an unlimited nudge patch to run this script effectively. Like above, edit const 'waittime' it is set to 60 seconds.
All the scripts are stopped by pressing the '[b]1[/b]' button . Watch your script once to see whether it has got the DTM correct or not, and for the auto chat, see whether the white color is detected.( You probably are looking at it since it [b]is[/b] a script run during chat :P)
BTW for some weird reason, you can only use nudge if your conversation screen is the small one, not the full screen one. Trying to work a way around this

item.title: Some useful MSN Scripts
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Haha, glad to help. Lols.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 03, 2007, 02:38:07 PM[/size][hr]I’ve made a MSN auto-reply, please test and tell me how it is!

Read full topic

item.title: Some useful MSN Scripts
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Thanks Script_owned4. I’ll try it out. Uh, dragonus18, Nudging is the equivalent of dinging in Yahoo messenger, but put simply it sorta shakes your friends chat window. For fun, but if your friend is doing something or his comp is lousy he would probably lag.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:

what is nudging? i don’t have msn and never have so i do not know this, could someone please fill me in?

Read full topic

item.title: Some useful MSN Scripts
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

Shadower:

Okay, no hard feelings. Btw, you don’t really need much I think, just have to check that it detects colors properly, and I added the button thingie if you wanna stop it before the timer runs out so I think that would be a failsafe right?

That would be one but a better would be:

begin 
 repeat 
 this;
 until(IsFKeyDown(FKey));

Read full topic

item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Okay, no hard feelings. Btw, you don’t really need much I think, just have to check that it detects colors properly, and I added the button thingie if you wanna stop it before the timer runs out so I think that would be a failsafe right?

item.title: Some useful MSN Scripts
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:6, topic:152081”][quote author=script_owned4 link=topic=208025.msg1826114#msg1826114 date=1192585561]
So you don’t know how to add a fail-safe?

Haha more new people, I hate them.
[/quote]

If you got nothing good to say, then don’t, at least, that way, you won’t have the privilege of replying to a thread taken from you.[/quote]
Erm, I was just saying that I could help him…

And if he doesen’t I could’ve helped him…

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:8, topic:152081”][quote author=script_owned4 link=topic=208025.msg1826114#msg1826114 date=1192585561]
So you don’t know how to add a fail-safe?

Haha more new people, I hate them.
[/quote]
You’re not that good yourself, so I’d shut it. Everyone must start from somewhere.

Shadower, just a tip to help.
Instead of the user editing the waits and such, you can add consts. They’re sort of like settings that are easily changable, example:

const Test = 500;

begin
  Writeln(inttostr(Test));
end.

or

[code]
const Seconds = 5; //Seconds to wait

begin
Wait(Seconds * 1000);
end.
[/code][/quote]
What I said before, I could’ve helped if he asked if he doesen’t know how to add a failsaife.

Yes or no question, doesen’t look like spam, much?

EDIT:Erm, I don’t post scripts and I have learned well.

Read full topic

item.title: Some useful MSN Scripts
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“script_owned4, post:4, topic:152081”]So you don’t know how to add a fail-safe?

Haha more new people, I hate them.[/quote]
You’re not that good yourself, so I’d shut it. Everyone must start from somewhere.

Shadower, just a tip to help.
Instead of the user editing the waits and such, you can add consts. They’re sort of like settings that are easily changable, example:

const Test = 500;

begin
  Writeln(inttostr(Test));
end.

or

const Seconds = 5; //Seconds to wait

begin
  Wait(Seconds * 1000);
end.

Read full topic

and Msn 6.5 is the best one that works on it,
I set myself to Busy and I can nudge all I want.

item.description:

[size=20pt]JUST UPLOADED!
[/size]

[size=10pt]MSN auto-reply.[/size]
It will detect any open chats, then reply to them and close the window.
Basically its abit tougher to use. Drag the crosshair onto your taskbar. Then adjust the number of
seconds under the constants, and also adjust the text you want written.
